intro: Saussurea nuda var. nuda, commonly known as the naked saussurea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of China and the Tibetan Plateau. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in rocky and sandy soils at high altitudes.
